cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 130 miles south of Negril, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating northwestward toward the Yucatán Channel, then into the central Gulf of Mexico and toward the Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: along the south-central Louisiana coast, near or just west of the Mississippi River delta

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Texas–Alabama, with highest risk along the Louisiana shoreline
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–60 mph) likely beginning late Thu and continuing into Fri; hurricane-force gusts possible if Delta strengthens before landfall.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential surge 3–6 ft along the lower Mississippi River and adjacent bays if the storm makes landfall just west of the delta.
weather_observation.rainfall: Widespread 4–8 inches with isolated higher totals, producing flash-flood risk along the river and low-lying terminal areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rapid water-level rise on the Mississippi River, possible tornadoes in the outer rain-bands, and prolonged channel closure due to high seas in approaches.
